snippet: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and god...
lead_paragraph: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and goddess, Hermes and Aphrodite. Hermes was a god of male sexuality (among other things) and Aphrodite a goddess of female sexuality, love, and beauty. Although the older terms are still included in this article for reference, they have been replaced by most experts (and patients and families) because they are misleading, confusing, and insensitive. Increasingly this group of conditions is being called disorders of sex development (DSDs).

headline.main: Intersex

Each year, six million women are assaulted/raped/murdered by their husbands or the men with whom they live.

headline.main: Battered Women

snippet: China executed two men Thursday morning for abducting and selling 15 children, many of them taken as babies or toddlers, the official Xinhua news agency said Friday. One of the men, Hu Minghua, 55, was convicted of kidnapping and selling nine chil...
lead_paragraph: China executed two men Thursday morning for abducting and selling 15 children, many of them taken as babies or toddlers, the official Xinhua news agency said Friday. One of the men, Hu Minghua, 55, was convicted of kidnapping and selling nine children. Five of the children, all boys now 3 to 6 years old, have been returned to their families, while the parents of the remaining ones have not been found. The other man, Su Binde, 27, was convicted of abducting six children. Five of those children were rescued by the police, while a sixth remains missing. Child trafficking is a big problem in China, where the traditional preference for male heirs and a restrictive one-child policy have driven a thriving market in baby boys, who sell for much more than girls. Girls and women are abducted and often used as laborers or as brides for unwed sons.
abstract: China executes Hu Minghua and Su Binde for abducting and selling 15 children, many who were taken as babies or toddlers; five children, all boys, have been returned to their families; child trafficking is big problem in China, where traditional preference for male heirs and one-child policy drive thriving market for boys (S)

headline.main: China: 2 Executed For Child Abductions

Typically, 105 males are born for every 100 females, reflecting the biological fact that males are more susceptible to fatal childhood diseases. Child-rearing practices in poorer countries that favor male children only add to a disparity in ratio that begins at birth.

snippet: A man was arrested this weekend for questioning in connection with a series of child molestations in the San Fernando Valley, the police said. They said the man fit a composite of the suspect but warned that the case was not solved. At least 32 ch...
lead_paragraph: A man was arrested this weekend for questioning in connection with a series of child molestations in the San Fernando Valley, the police said. They said the man fit a composite of the suspect but warned that the case was not solved. At least 32 children, male and female, have been assaulted or nearly assaulted in the past two months, most as they walked to school, the police said. At least one rape occurred. The police have until Tuesday to decide whether to seek charges.

headline.main: Arrest in Child Molestations

snippet: To the Editor:   Re "Companies Merge; Families Break Up" (Op-Ed, Sept. 3): Lester C. Thurow correctly points out that the decline in men's wages is a major cause of family change. But he implies that the answer to family break-up and child neglect...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re "Companies Merge; Families Break Up" (Op-Ed, Sept. 3): Lester C. Thurow correctly points out that the decline in men's wages is a major cause of family change. But he implies that the answer to family break-up and child neglect is to shore up male wages and restore the "traditional" family. While better jobs for all is a desirable goal, returning to a system of male breadwinning is an unworkable and, for many families, undesirable solution.

headline.main: Corporate Giants Tighten Their Hold on U.S.; Homemaker Nostalgia

lead_paragraph: I could get a marriage license tomorrow that would sanction my relationship with any one of my male friends. No one would ask if we intended to raise children together, grow old together or any of the other things that supposedly ''sanctify'' marriage. And we would instantly earn the rights of all married couples. But the one person whose relationship with me truly is a marriage -- with whom I'm raising a child, with whom I intend to grow old -- is the one person who would be turned away at the clerk's office if we applied to be ''married.'' Roseann Foley Henry Brooklyn

headline.main: What's Their Real Problem With Gay Marriage? (It's the Gay Part)
URGES EXTENDING CHILD AID; Onondaga Judge Wants Law to Assist Children of Invalid Fathers.

snippet: Egypt's president said Tuesday he was alarmed by his country's high divorce rate, suggesting a ground-breaking legislation to delegalize divorces verbally declared by Muslim men to their spouses, the latest foray by the general-turned-president in...
lead_paragraph: Egypt's president said Tuesday he was alarmed by his country's high divorce rate, suggesting a ground-breaking legislation to delegalize divorces verbally declared by Muslim men to their spouses, the latest foray by the general-turned-president into thorny social and cultural issues in the most populous Arab nation.

headline.main: Egypt's El-Sissi Says He Is Alarmed by High Divorce Rates
headline.print_headline: Egypt's El-Sissi Says He Is Alarmed by High Divorce Rates

snippet: To the Editor:    Of the five dads who commented in the article, four were caring for children at or over preschool age. Many women, after a brutal financial calculation, conclude that any income they earned from working would be canceled out by f...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Of the five dads who commented in the article, four were caring for children at or over preschool age. Many women, after a brutal financial calculation, conclude that any income they earned from working would be canceled out by fees for preschool or child care programs. They therefore stay at home, preferring to spend time with their growing children.

headline.main: Life as the Only Man in the Room at the P.T.A.

snippet: Infertility is the inability of a couple to become pregnant after 12 months of unprotected intercourse....
lead_paragraph: Infertility is the inability of a couple to become pregnant after 12 months of unprotected intercourse.

headline.main: Infertility in Women

snippet: To the Editor:     Recent developments that would allow expectant parents to choose their baby's sex (front page, Sept. 9) open troubling questions over whether a company developing these techniques should be allowed to decide whether parents who ...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Recent developments that would allow expectant parents to choose their baby's sex (front page, Sept. 9) open troubling questions over whether a company developing these techniques should be allowed to decide whether parents who already have two or three children of the same sex have a more valid right to choose the sex of their next child than parents who don't already have children.
abstract: S Rebecca Holmes-Farley letter, commenting on September 9 article, says method developed by researchers at Genetics & IVF Institute allowing parents to choose sex of child raises troubling ethical questions (S)

headline.main: Who Should Decide The Sex of a Baby?
